results.title: How Not To Be Seen
results.brief_description: A satirical take on instructional films, How Not to Be Seen features a mix of actual and virtual performers and scenes, which illustrate the strategies for becoming invisible, communicated in an authoritative narrative voiceover. - MoMA
results.description: A satirical take on instructional films, How Not to Be Seen features a mix of actual and virtual performers and scenes, which illustrate the strategies for becoming invisible, communicated in an authoritative narrative voiceover. - MoMA

results.title: How much does the earth weigh?: measurement and mass
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how to calculate the size and composition of the earth, explaining the difference between weight and mass using a spring scale and a balance scale. Also covers the scientific ideas of displacement, volume and density.

results.title: How much affection?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marriage and Family Living”.
A social guidance docu-drama promoting restraint against premarital sex. After nearly succumbing to her boyfriend’s advances, teenager Laurie seeks her mother’s advice. Following a sensible discussion with her mother and the lesson provided by her friend Eileen, a victim of her physical urges, Laurie considers the long term consequences of sexual temptation.

results.title: How many colours? = Cuantos colores?
results.creator_credit: Adam Sebire, Patrik Axen and AFTRS
results.brief_description: This short film asks us to consider the colours of Cuba: the variety of colours of the tobacco in their cigars; the multicultural array of colours of its people; the colours of socialism and the colours of the capitalists who are making it a tourist haven. Filmed largely in one of Havana’s biggest cigar producing factories, this film is also a celebration of a revolutionary culture where workers and working life has not become exclusively mechanised and rationalised. A vibrant celebration of Cuba, workers, unionism and the much maligned tobacco leaf.

results.title: How lightning shatters wood : the primeaval steam engine
results.brief_description: SUMMARY:Illustrates some of the effects of lightning. Shows alaboratory demonstration of lightning shattering wood. Lightning shatters trees with steam, this steam energy being converted into kinetic energy

results.title: How life begins
results.creator_credit: Gene Feldman, Daniel Wilson, American Broadcasting Company and Jules Power Productions
results.brief_description: Provides an understanding of the many and varied ways in which organisms, both simple and complex, reproduce. Introduces concepts of mitosis, courtship, nesting, fertilization and embryological development. Narrated by Eddie Albert.

results.title: How level is sea level
results.creator_credit: Larry Klingman and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Defines mean sea level and explains how it is determined. Describes factors that influence sea level at various locations, and analyses the problems of creating a sea level canal in Central America.

results.title: How language grows
results.creator_credit: John Honey, Barry Pierce and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Examines the various stages of language development in children from birth to six-year-old. Shows how parents can positively support and contribute to their child’s language development.
